section.title: Per-user versus system-wide maintenance
section.para: The &MiKTeX; maintenance utilities (&MiKTeXOptions;, &MiKTeXUpdateWizard; and &MiKTeXPackageManager;) now come in two variants:

listitem.para: the standard variant is used to change &MiKTeX; settings for the current user
the admin variant is used to to change &MiKTeX; settings for all users

section.para: Therefore, if a user runs the standard variant of the package manager, packages will be installed in the private installation directory. In contrast, if a user runs the admin variant of the package manager, packages will be installed in the system-wide installation directory.
In order to run the admin variant, a user must have administrator privileges.
The command-line versions of the maintenance utilities (initexmf and mpm) accept the --admin option to run in admin mode

section.title: \write18 partially enabled
section.para: The \write18 feature is now partially enabled by default: only known commands are allowed.

section.title: Per-user &TEXMF; roots
section.para: It is now possible to set up &TEXMF; root directories on a per-user basis, i.e., users can register their private &TEXMF; root directories.

section.title: Per-user package management
section.para: Packages can now be installed in a user-private installation directory.

section.title: &MiKTeXPortable;
section.para: The new portable edition makes it possible to run &MiKTeX; from a portable storage device:

listitem.para: &MiKTeX; on a portable storage device is ready for use on any &Windows; computer
configuration settings are stored on the portable storage device and not in the &WindowsRegistry; of the host computer
no traces are left on the host computer
no administrator privileges are required on the host computer

section.para: &MiKTeXPortable; is distributed as a &SevenZip; self-extracting archive.
Please visit the &MiKTeXPortable; Homepage, for more information.

section.title: &TeXworks;
section.para: The &MiKTeX; distribution now includes &TeXworks;, an integrated development environment for &TeX; and &LaTeX; written by Jonathan Kew.
&TeXworks; includes a text editor, a previewer, syntax highlighting, spell checking, Unicode support.
This version of &TeXworks; is specially for &MiKTeX;. See the TeXworks for MiKTeX homepage, for more information.

section.title: File type associations
section.para: &TeX; input documents (*.tex, *.ltx, …) and &PDF; documents (*.pdf) are associated with &TeXworks;.
